Articles.Content:
Have you ever had a dream you couldn't give up on? A design that went through hundreds of iterations to get working or get right? Well this was mine. To get a Kerbal off the surface of Eve without resorting to having to build a 200 ton monster, (although in hindsight that might have been easier).

The plane is stock, with the exception of MechJeb, which I only used for information purposes. It wasn't a pretty ascent, nor is it a pretty plane, but it got the job done.

Craft File.

Edited April 20, 2014 by Redshift OTF
You should submit it to Kraken Drive thread
Gratz! How did you get it to gain speed without spending fuel in lower atmo?

Rofl, wird but it get the job done!

Good work sir.

Gratz! How did you get it to gain speed without spending fuel in lower atmo?

Infini-assisted. The control surfaces generate thrust when SAS is enabled.
Oh,I was expecting to see some real plane,Because I thought about that,maybe a plane could save me from eve,but it didnt worked.

And they tell me that certain mods reduce realism. lol Just look at how realistic that plane is!

Nice work. This must have taken patience to deal with.
I never thought about using a infi-rocket combo. Especially not on eve.

I never thought about using a infi-rocket combo. Especially not on eve.

Might as well use the atmosphere to your advantage.

Yeah it's a crazy design but it's the only design I could get to work.

*cough*exploit*cough*

Seriously though, I have 2 objections:

A. Won't work in FAR

B. It's exploitative(is that a word? ^^) of the game's lame (to say the least) atmospheric model.
That is great. I love it. Must've taken forever to design.

I've included the craft file in the original post if any brave souls are willing to try this themselves. Use SAS sparingly at low altitudes. There are no yaw controllable surfaces for stability purposes so you will have to roll and pitch a lot. You can Hyperedit the ship around Eve or build a transfer vehicle for it.

Also, as a bonus, I have included the original version that got into LKO. No need for engines, just flap to get above 30 m/s, pitch to 50 degrees and engage SAS. RUD may occur.

Kerbin Ascent Wing

Edited April 20, 2014 by Redshift OTF

Most know that infinite glide can take you to orbit, no reason for it not to work on Eve or Jool that that reason.

Now would an ion powered plane work, with the new engines it look like it should work with However I suck at planes.

You've used a lot of brain cycles to work this one out. Respect.

But I won't try this, I challenge you to do an Eve ascent using FAR. Good luck!

It may be a bit of an exploit, but good infinigliders aren't simple to build. Plus the final speeder bike type stage looks awesome. Well done, this is an impresive achievement.

I also enjoyed how the kerbals expression goes from smugg to excited as he goes up.

Thanks for the positive feedback. It's more a bit of fun than anything. I did initially try and refit the Kerbin Wing for ion engines but didn't have a lot of success. Although they have amazing ISP they are too heavy and don't have enough TWR to punch out of the atmosphere. Perhaps if I used the Eve Wing with ions I would have more success however the burn times are typically too long to circularise at apoapsis.
